results.definition: sound recording consisting of a disk with a continuous groove; used to reproduce music by rotating while a phonograph needle tracks in the groove
indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments
a compilation of the known facts regarding something or someone
examples: Al Smith used to say, `Let's look at the record'
his name is in all the record books
the lawyer has a good record
the track record shows that he will be a good president

results.definition: a list of crimes for which an accused person has been previously convicted
examples: he ruled that the criminal record of the defendant could not be disclosed to the court
the prostitute had a record a mile long

results.definition: make a record of; set down in permanent form
a document that can serve as legal evidence of a transaction
examples: they could find no record of the purchase

results.definition: an extreme attainment; the best (or worst) performance ever attested (as in a sport)
examples: coffee production last year broke all previous records

results.definition: anything (such as a document or a phonograph record or a photograph) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events
examples: the film provided a valuable record of stage techniques

results.definition: the number of wins versus losses and ties a team has had
examples: at 9-0 they have the best record in their league
